pullRequest.title: Do not create a new Exam Session when viewing the Summary
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.

Motivation and Context
When viewing the exam summary after an exam, a new exam session is created.
This is (a) unneeded and (b) makes analyzing exam sessions harder as we need to filter for sessions within the working time.
Description
In this PR, we add a new endpoint to view the summary without creating an exam session. This endpoint may. only be called after submitting or end of working time.
Steps for Testing

Participate in Exam
find exam session in the database


summary loads after the end of exam
summary loads after handing in early


after leaving the exam, open page in another browser
do not find new exam session in the database.

commit.message: Do not create a new Exam Session when viewing the Summary
Add two handy methods to get the individual end date of a student exam
Add new checks for exam review
Refactor other method and avoid duplication
Always allow instructors to see everything and refactor code a bit
Get the user upfront and avoid many database queries

fix modeling exercise assement access & remove the score in points of the quiz submission
Instructors should always be able to see the assessment if an assessment is available
Small refactorings

nodes.bodyText: Unless this is needed in the webapp, we should mark this with @JsonIgnore. I think otherwise, Jackson will serialize this.
Unless this is needed in the webapp, we should mark this with @JsonIgnore. I think otherwise, Jackson will serialize this.
I think there is a @link missing
I don't see where this is used.
Is it intended that students who haven't submitted their solution, can use this call after their exam ended? This wasn't possible before.

I think this still isn't right. Scenario hand-in early: isSubmitted = true & isEnded = false. This would lead to forbidden(). Couldn't we just use isSubmitted? If the student handed in his exam then his exam is definitely over.

commit.message: Merge branch 'exam/view-summary-no-session' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into exam/view-summary-no-session
Extract submission generation code into method and avoid duplication
